They're lovely, but unless we get some RPM-equivalent functionality into the stock game, they're just visual candy.

Still, it's a step in the right direction.

This is inviting stock version of Raster Prop moniter + oculus rift support.... a lot....

Maybe just try the unity default rift stuff... just to see... just to try....
Looking great, love the science lab!
These look amazing! Really happy to see these in-game.
Oh my god, those are amazing! Great work, dude!

One more idea for science lab: I think it needs a tank (or compartment) labeled "mystery goo." We carry that stuff all over the solar system ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
Those look fantastic! Looking forward to using them!
Very nice! That lab module definitely looks like it's begging for free-form "floating" IVAs or at the very least more seats.

OMG MK1 inline!

soo much thank you!

Looks pretty good.

Though, if I may critique, the science lab is well modeled, and looks good, but doesn't really seem like a laboratory. 

Which is a pity, the others look well suited to their respective roles. 

The 'lab' here's a lot of empty space where there should be science equipment. At the moment, it's more like a crew and storage area than a lab. The seat position is reasonable for travel, but not for working.

There doesn't seem to be any sort of workspace, which surely is the main thing the part should provide.

Here are some examples from the ISS of science areas:

![s122e008911.jpg](http://spaceflight1.nasa.gov/gallery/images/shuttle/sts-122/hires/s122e008911.jpg)

![i19_025588.jpg](http://cache.boston.com/universal/site_graphics/blogs/bigpicture/iss_11_24/i19_025588.jpg)

![sts120_fisheye02.jpg](http://collectspace.com/review/sts120_fisheye02.jpg)

![Columbus_Illustration.gif](https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/8/83/Columbus_Illustration.gif)

Plus, the fact that everything is vertically oriented could be a bit of a design flaw. In space, there is no up and down, and that part also lends itself to being landed horizontally. Designing this part prioritising vertical use seems like an odd choice, considering its mainly used for stations and bases. 

At the moment, it doesn't look much like a science lab, just an extended version of the hitchhiker cabin with different cupboards. I can't really see it being a useful place to do science. Unfortunately, I doubt Squad cares enough to let there be changes.

Also, in the MK3 crew cabin, are those seats lined up so all the kerbals can see out the windows? It's hard to see from the picture.
